title: Lizzie McGuire filming has started as Hilary Duff gives first look
text:
Can’t wait for this! (Picture: Splash/ Walt Disney)

Filming for the new Lizzie McGuire movie has officially started – and it’s getting fans hyped up already.

As if we weren’t were excited enough to see Hilary Duff back on our screens, the actress has now teased Lizzie fans with a photo from on set in New York.

‘Hey now, hey now, these are what dreams are made of’ – yes we are singing it already.

She captioned the photo: ‘Happy first LIZZIE day!!!!! NYC…..cue the rain #lizziemcguire.’

Dressed in a yellow coat with matching tartan skirt and top, Hilary looks as happy as we do about the Disney+ reboot.

This has definitely got fans hyped up (Picture: Splash News)

The comments came rushing in, complimenting Hilary on her outfit as well as sharing their excitement for the movie.

One fan commented: ‘I’ve never been so happy in my entire life.’

Another gushed: ‘My childhood!!! Long Live Lizzie!!!’

Hey now hey nowwww (Picture: Disney)

The new Lizzie McGuire series sees our teen protagonist (played by Hilary) all grown up and living in New York in her 30s.

However, it seems she will be returning to California soon enough to rejoin her mum Jo (Hallie Todd), dad Sam (Robert Carradine) and brother Matt (Jake Thomas).

Lizzie McGuire only ran for two seasons – but 65 episodes – from 2001 until 2004, but had a huge fanbase, which was only boosted with the release of The Lizzie McGuire Movie in 2003.

The show followed Lizzie, a 13-year-old girl, as she navigated family drama, first crushes and school with her best friends Gordo (Adam Lamberg) and Miranda (Lalaine) – with an animated version of Lizzie sharing her innermost thoughts.

The reboot, however, will see Lizzie as a 30-year-old, with Hilary – who is now a mum-of-two – telling E! News: ‘What are the struggles of a 30-year-old right nowWhat are the pressures that life throws in front of a woman who is 30 and doesn’t have all the things yet?’

Sadly, despite their kiss at the end of the movie, Lizzie and Gordo aren’t together anymore – but Hilary is hopeful Adam will be joining the other OG members of the cast at some point.

She told Vulture: ‘I really hope he’s going to be involved. We’ve been planning out the season and coming up with what everything looks like, and it’s so important for him to be there for part of it.’
